description.raw:
This PR adds helper functions for setting a `MassMatrix3` object based on the geometry of some simple shapes (box, sphere, and cylinder aligned with z axis). There is also a function called `EquivalentBox` that returns the shape and orientation of a box with equivalent inertia to the current `MassMatrix3` object. Note that the orientation is not unique due to box symmetry.

This also includes a few small numerical enhancements to the `MassMatrix3` algorithms that have been split into pull request #109 to simplify the review process. The diff for this PR will be smaller after that one is merged.

If you want to test this pull request with gazebo, use [gazebo branch inertia_vis](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/compare/inertia_vis%0Dgazebo7), which uses these functions to rescale the inertia of simple shapes when the resize tool is used from the simulation window. It also replaces a few instances of inertia calculations.

This also includes a few small numerical enhancements to the MassMatrix3 algorithms that have been split into pull request #109 to simplify the review process. The diff for this PR will be smaller after that one is merged.

If you want to test this pull request with gazebo, use gazebo branch inertia_vis, which uses these functions to rescale the inertia of simple shapes when the resize tool is used from the simulation window. It also replaces a few instances of inertia calculations.
